Experience Environmental Health and Safety Engineer Intel Corporation 2015  – Present (less than a year) Hillsboro, Oregon EHS Co-op PaperWorks Industries, Inc. April 2014  –  March 2015  (1 year) Greater Philadelphia Area -Assist whenever needed in a variety of Corporate EHS tasks. 
 
-Manage and update permit and compliance data, monthly hours worked, audit results, and other EHS data through the Enablon software. 
 
-Assist with creating audit questionnaires, conducting audits, and creating reports with audit findings. 
 
-Create company-wide EHS Talking Points and a newsletter. 
 
-Conduct Job Hazard Analyses. 
 
-Assisted in writing a new EHS Policy Manual. 
 
-Created and edited forms and a manual addressing EHS and financial considerations whenever equipment is transferred, removed, sold, or purchased in a company facility. Front End Cashier Wegmans Food Markets April 2006  –  April 2014  (8 years 1 month) Chili, NY -Provide excellent customer service, and assist other departments as needed. Environmental Management, and Facilities and Processing Engineering Intern Green Mountain Coffee Roasters June 2013  –  August 2013  (3 months) Waterbury, VT -Created a Permit and Training Calendar 
 
-Interviewed Facility Managers to develop and edit Standard Operating Procedures 
 
-Created a guide for handling hazardous waste to satisfy RCRA and DOT regulations 
 
-Completed 8 hour DOT hazardous waste course 
 
-Assisted with compliance, and beyond compliance at the multi-site facilities 
 
-Attended several "Lunch and Learn" events with topics such as: Social Media, Women in the Workplace, Corporate Social Responsibility, Coffee Cupping, and Research and Development to learn from employees and other interns. 
 
-Attended "Beverage University" and a Barista training to learn about the process of growing and harvesting coffee beans, roasting, the different flavors and origins, and how to brew coffee and espresso. -Analyzed the distribution of state funding through the AEM program, and how it relates to water quality, then presented a report to the NYS Soil and Water Conservation Committee. 
 
-Attended “Conservation Bootcamp”, to learn first-hand about the implication of best management practices on farmland, how to survey land for the construction of an irrigation system, and was educated by several professionals in related fields from around the state. Summary My name is Kent Clouse a safety professional looking to expand my horizons in the field of Environmental Health and Safety. I look forward to be considered as part of a challenging and rewarding safety team.  
 
Over the breadth of internships and my career, I’ve been able to work to meet safety goals, empower employee safety and maintain company compliance. I have had the opportunity during my years as a safety professional to lead various teams, build creative problem solving skills and generate excitement in those around me about safety. As you will note in the accomplishments under the experience section, my expertise covers various aspects of safety management that may be beneficial to your company. Please do not hesitate to contact me with any questions or opportunities you may have. Experience Safety Engineer Intel Corporation March 2010  – Present (5 years 6 months) Operating extensive auditing for construction, facility contractors, lab safety and office safety. Support various safety programs from electrical to chemical and ensure compliance through self assessments of these programs.  
Assist management of the business group to come up with controls or evaluate hazards to determine what is best to supply a safe work environment. Engineering activities including designing or solving safety problems analyzing incidents and evaluating root cause and future prevention.  
Presenting in safety leaders team, lab managers council being an active role to talk about safety expectations, compliance, lessons learned, proactive communication through self assessments and cross site auditing. Communicating to lab managers and Intel management safe work practices and Intel safety compliance to keep all employees safe. Safety Intern John Deere May 2009  –  August 2009  (4 months) Safety and health program evaluation by enhancing various subjects of safety and implementing them site wide. Programs included confined space, overhead crane, hoist, sling and hook program, powered industrial truck program, lock out tag out procedure program and machine guarding.  
Implemented the training site wide. Fork truck drivers got an updated refresher course along with new pre-shift inspection sheets that were more organized and less tedious.  
Hazard Evaluation by assisting with safety audits, incident investigations and made EHS map and comprehensive list of permit required confined spaces to help identify the amount and location of each. Assisted with SERA (Safety and Ergonomic Risk Assessment) which is a program geared towards identifying ergonomic risks of operators. Safety Intern John Deere May 2008  –  August 2008  (4 months) Safety Training and Education on various safety subjects including Lock out tag out affected employee training, overhead crane and hoist inspection training, near miss safety system training, JSA and JHA training for each job functions. Created and Implement a behavioral based safety program and training site wide.  
Program enhancement included PPE written program, JSA written program and identification for each job function. Created a behavioral based safety program and written program document. Implemented an office ergonomic check sheet to determine if our office employees were at ergonomic risk to assist with putting controls in place to mitigate these hazards. 
Investigation and statistical reporting through continual audits and assisting with safety investigations. Oversaw the corrective action review board which was a field based team of plant management to review corrective safety actions.
